page.title: 03DENTON VILLAGE
page.content: The village school is constructed in iron stone. It has thirty children, of five to eleven years of age, and two teachers. The children have to go to Grantham to secondary school. In 1983 the Education Committee decided to close a number of small village schools as part of a policy of rationalisation and cost cutting. The villagers united to resist this and the school won a temporary reprieve. There is only one shop in the village, a combined general store and sub post office.Most people use this once a week, the main shopping being done in Grantham. In a questionaire which asked amongst other things "If you would like to see another amenity in Denton, please state which", a large majority answered -- a children's playing field.
